attributes.name: ConditionalLoggingPattern

problem.description: Need debug output in production without performance impact

solution.approach: Logger.getActiveLevels() check before expensive debug operations
solution.implementation: Runtime log level checking with conditional rendering

applicability: Any application requiring conditional debug output

observations.content: Originally developed in DynArch autonomous driving visualization system
Advanced dual-axis filtering: 5 log levels + 13 specialized categories
Persistent configuration via localStorage with UI controls
Dynamic color system with automatic contrast calculation
Global console access for runtime debugging: window.Logger
Hierarchical level activation and category grouping
Zero performance impact when logging disabled
Also implemented in TimelineProject with React integration
Pattern: Logger.log(level, category, ...messages) with runtime filtering
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ConditionalLoggingPattern.md

legacy_observations: Originally developed in DynArch autonomous driving visualization system
Advanced dual-axis filtering: 5 log levels + 13 specialized categories
Persistent configuration via localStorage with UI controls
Dynamic color system with automatic contrast calculation
Global console access for runtime debugging: window.Logger
Hierarchical level activation and category grouping
Zero performance impact when logging disabled
Also implemented in TimelineProject with React integration
Pattern: Logger.log(level, category, ...messages) with runtime filtering
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ConditionalLoggingPattern.md

attributes.name: ViewportCullingPattern

problem.description: 3D scenes with many objects causing frame rate drops

solution.approach: Calculate object distance from camera, hide objects beyond threshold
solution.implementation: Distance-based viewport culling for performance optimization

observations.content: Problem: Rendering 200+ timeline events caused <10 FPS
Solution: Only render objects within camera view distance
Implementation: camera.position.distanceTo(object.position) < threshold
Result: Improved from 200 objects to ~20-50 visible, 60 FPS achieved
Transferable: Essential pattern for any 3D scene with many objects
References: https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/wiki/How-to-dispose-of-objects, https://docs.pmnd.rs/react-three-fiber/advanced/scaling-performance, https://threejs.org/docs/#api/en/math/Frustum
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ViewportCullingPattern.md

legacy_observations: Problem: Rendering 200+ timeline events caused <10 FPS
Solution: Only render objects within camera view distance
Implementation: camera.position.distanceTo(object.position) < threshold
Result: Improved from 200 objects to ~20-50 visible, 60 FPS achieved
Transferable: Essential pattern for any 3D scene with many objects
References: https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/wiki/How-to-dispose-of-objects, https://docs.pmnd.rs/react-three-fiber/advanced/scaling-performance, https://threejs.org/docs/#api/en/math/Frustum
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ViewportCullingPattern.md

attributes.name: ReduxStateManagementPattern

problem.description: Complex React state becoming unmanageable and inconsistent

solution.approach: Separate slices for UI, data, preferences with typed hooks
solution.implementation: Redux Toolkit with feature-based slice organization

applicability: Complex React applications requiring predictable state

observations.content: Problem: useState becoming unmaintainable across 15+ components
Solution: Redux Toolkit with feature-based slices (ui, timeline, prefs)
Pattern: createSlice() + typed useSelector/useDispatch hooks
Benefits: Predictable state, time-travel debugging, persistence integration
Transferable: Standard pattern for complex React applications
References: https://redux-toolkit.js.org/, https://react-redux.js.org/tutorials/typescript-quick-start, https://redux.js.org/usage/usage-with-typescript
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ReduxStateManagementPattern.md

legacy_observations: Problem: useState becoming unmaintainable across 15+ components
Solution: Redux Toolkit with feature-based slices (ui, timeline, prefs)
Pattern: createSlice() + typed useSelector/useDispatch hooks
Benefits: Predictable state, time-travel debugging, persistence integration
Transferable: Standard pattern for complex React applications
References: https://redux-toolkit.js.org/, https://react-redux.js.org/tutorials/typescript-quick-start, https://redux.js.org/usage/usage-with-typescript
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ReduxStateManagementPattern.md

attributes.name: KnowledgePersistencePattern

problem.description: AI agents lose project context and patterns between sessions

solution.approach: Agent-agnostic knowledge persistence with JSON knowledge base + optional MCP integration
solution.implementation: Agent-agnostic knowledge persistence with JSON knowledge base + optional MCP integration

observations.content: Problem: AI agents lose project context and patterns between sessions
Solution: Agent-agnostic knowledge persistence with JSON knowledge base + optional MCP integration
Architecture: JSON as source of truth, MCP for runtime enhancement, ukb/vkb for capture/visualization
Key insight: Universal design works with any AI agent, not just Claude
Implementation: Git-tracked shared-memory.json + auto-sync + structured capture tools
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/KnowledgePersistencePattern.md
Transferable: Any AI-assisted development workflow
Significance: 9/10

attributes.name: NetworkAwareInstallationPattern

problem.description: Enterprise software installations failing in corporate networks with proxies and SSH restrictions

solution.approach: Multi-stage detection provides reliability without manual configuration while supporting both corporate mirrors and public repositories
solution.implementation: Network-aware detection with graceful fallbacks for different network environments

applicability: Enterprise development tools, CI/CD systems, developer onboarding scripts, multi-repository projects with mixed dependencies

observations.content: Problem: Enterprise software installations failing in corporate networks with proxies and SSH restrictions
Solution: Network-aware detection with graceful fallbacks for different network environments
Key learnings: Network detection patterns, timeout-based operations, graceful degradation, selective repository mirroring based on network context
Applicability: Enterprise development tools, CI/CD systems, developer onboarding scripts, multi-repository projects with mixed dependencies
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/NetworkAwareInstallationPattern.md
Significance: 9/10

legacy_observations: Problem: Enterprise software installations failing in corporate networks with proxies and SSH restrictions

attributes.name: StateDrivenAnimationPipelinePattern

problem.description: Complex animation systems struggle with coordinating multiple components and managing performance

solution.approach: Abstract base components + centralized manager + event-driven state management
solution.implementation: Hierarchical animation pipeline with standardized lifecycle management and centralized coordination

applicability: Animation systems, real-time simulations, game engines, interactive visualizations

observations.content: Developed in DynArch for coordinating 15+ simultaneous animation components
Standardized lifecycle: initialize → start → pause → stop → destroy
Single animation loop coordination via requestAnimationFrame
Event-driven state management with async task tracking
Dynamic component registration/unregistration without disruption
Maintains 60fps with complex processor and sensor animations
Graceful error handling - individual failures don't crash system
Transferable to any system requiring coordinated animation management
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/StateDrivenAnimationPipelinePattern.md

legacy_observations: Developed in DynArch for coordinating 15+ simultaneous animation components
Standardized lifecycle: initialize → start → pause → stop → destroy
Single animation loop coordination via requestAnimationFrame
Event-driven state management with async task tracking
Dynamic component registration/unregistration without disruption
Maintains 60fps with complex processor and sensor animations
Graceful error handling - individual failures don't crash system
Transferable to any system requiring coordinated animation management
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/StateDrivenAnimationPipelinePattern.md

attributes.name: ClaudeCodeStartupPattern

problem.description: Claude Code fails to utilize established knowledge base patterns across sessions

solution.approach: Automatic knowledge base consumption with pattern verification at session start
solution.implementation: Mandatory startup checklist to query MCP memory and apply established patterns

applicability: All Claude Code sessions requiring consistent pattern application

observations.content: MANDATORY: At session start, always query MCP memory for relevant patterns
Execute: mcp__memory__search_nodes for key patterns like ConditionalLoggingPattern, ReduxStateManagementPattern
NEVER use console.log - always use Logger class from ConditionalLoggingPattern
NEVER use local React state - always use Redux from ReduxStateManagementPattern
NEVER edit shared-memory.json directly - ALWAYS use ukb --interactive or ukb --auto
ukb is available in PATH from /Users/q284340/Agentic/coding/bin/ukb and works from anywhere
ALWAYS check for existing architectural patterns before implementing solutions
Session startup checklist: 1) Query MCP memory, 2) Apply relevant patterns, 3) Verify logging is working, 4) Use ukb for knowledge management
This pattern prevents repeating architectural mistakes across sessions
If claude-mcp is used, knowledge base should be automatically loaded and consumed
Failure to follow this pattern results in reinventing existing solutions and architectural mistakes

legacy_observations: MANDATORY: At session start, always query MCP memory for relevant patterns
Execute: mcp__memory__search_nodes for key patterns like ConditionalLoggingPattern, ReduxStateManagementPattern
NEVER use console.log - always use Logger class from ConditionalLoggingPattern
NEVER use local React state - always use Redux from ReduxStateManagementPattern
NEVER edit shared-memory.json directly - ALWAYS use ukb --interactive or ukb --auto
ukb is available in PATH from /Users/q284340/Agentic/coding/bin/ukb and works from anywhere
ALWAYS check for existing architectural patterns before implementing solutions

This pattern prevents repeating architectural mistakes across sessions
If claude-mcp is used, knowledge base should be automatically loaded and consumed
Failure to follow this pattern results in reinventing existing solutions and architectural mistakes

attributes.name: StrategyBasedModularRoutingPattern

problem.description: Complex geometric routing systems need extensible algorithms without core modifications

solution.approach: Factory creates specialized handlers + modular strategies + shared base functionality
solution.implementation: Strategy and Factory pattern-based routing with pluggable handlers for different connection types

applicability: Geometric routing, pathfinding, connection systems, network visualization

observations.content: Developed in DynArch for handling multiple routing algorithms (Camera, Radar, Corridor)
Extensible architecture allows runtime registration of new routing strategies
Handles 50+ simultaneous connections with different routing strategies
Specialized algorithms: curved paths for cameras, obstacle avoidance for radar
Dynamic boundary calculations and collision detection
Route calculation: <5ms simple routes, <20ms complex avoidance routes
Configuration-driven behavior modification without code changes
Transferable to network visualization, circuit design, game pathfinding
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/StrategyBasedModularRoutingPattern.md

legacy_observations: Developed in DynArch for handling multiple routing algorithms (Camera, Radar, Corridor)

attributes.name: MCPMemoryLoggingIntegrationPattern

problem.description: MCP logging systems need different approaches for interactive vs piped modes

solution.approach: Interactive mode requires different logging approach than piped mode - MCP memory sync with verification
solution.implementation: Claude-mcp wrapper ensures both logging AND knowledge consumption with mode-aware logging

applicability: Any MCP-based system requiring both conversation logging and knowledge persistence

observations.content: Problem: Automatic logging system designed for --print mode with piped input fails in interactive mode
Solution: Mode-aware logging with MCP memory sync verification
Key insight: Interactive mode needs different logging approach than piped mode
Transferable: Any AI-assisted development system with MCP integration
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/mcpmemoryloggingintegration.md

legacy_observations: Problem: Automatic logging system designed for --print mode with piped input fails in interactive mode

Transferable: Any AI-assisted development system with MCP integration

attributes.name: UKBComprehensiveAnalysisPattern

problem.description: Development teams need comprehensive understanding of codebase evolution, architectural decisions, and transferable patterns across projects

solution.approach: Multi-mode analysis system combining git history mining, conversation analysis, and interactive knowledge capture with automatic schema management
solution.implementation: UKB (Update Knowledge Base) system with incremental processing, full history analysis, and intelligent pattern extraction

applicability: Any software development team requiring codebase understanding, knowledge transfer, architecture reviews, technical debt management, or cross-project learning

observations.content: Problem: Teams need comprehensive codebase understanding and knowledge transfer capabilities
Solution: Multi-mode analysis system with incremental processing and full history analysis
Key features: Git history mining, conversation analysis, schema management, pattern extraction
Modes: Incremental (default), Full History, Interactive, Agent-assisted
Benefits: 70% faster onboarding, comprehensive technical debt assessment, data-driven architecture reviews
Scale: Handles repositories with 10,000+ commits, 90% time savings on subsequent runs
Integration: MCP memory, git-tracked storage, web visualization, AI agent support
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/ukbcomprehensiveanalysispattern.md

legacy_observations: Problem: Teams need comprehensive codebase understanding and knowledge transfer capabilities
Solution: Multi-mode analysis system with incremental processing and full history analysis

problem.description: Developers need to capture knowledge insights without leaving their IDE or switching between tools, which breaks development flow and reduces the likelihood of documenting patterns
symptoms: Knowledge capture tools require separate applications

solution.approach: Integrate ukb/vkb commands directly into GitHub Copilot chat through VSCode extension bridge, providing natural language interface with real-time feedback
solution.implementation: VSCode extension with chat participant registration, HTTP API client, WebSocket real-time updates, and fallback service management

applicability: VSCode extension development for developer tools

observations.content: Problem: Context switching between IDE and knowledge management tools disrupts development flow
Solution: Native IDE integration through GitHub Copilot chat participant @km
Implementation: VSCode extension with HTTP API client and WebSocket for real-time updates
Result: Seamless knowledge capture with <500ms response time and real-time notifications
Transferable: Pattern applicable to any IDE-based developer tool integration requiring chat interfaces
